other_tests.findings: Dramatic resolution of clinical and biochemical abnormalities including weight loss, decreased body fat, normalization of plasma triglycerides, and improvement in hyperinsulinemia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Weight loss began within 2 weeks; total fat mass decreased from 34.3 kg to 18.4 kg over 48 months. Hyperinsulinemia normalized by 6 months, and TSH levels remained within normal ranges after withdrawal of T4 treatment at 36 months.

other_tests.findings: Elevated TSH detected during initial evaluations; elevated TSH rose to 16.4 mU/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 12 months of leptin therapy, free T4 levels were above the upper limit. After withdrawing T4 at 34 months, TSH and free T4 levels remained within normal ranges for 14 months.

other_tests.findings: White blood cell count doubled within the first month of therapy without evidence of infection.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Returned to normal within several weeks; reduction in urinary tract infections and episodes of perineal dermatitis was noted.
